abstracts.cdata!:
The Sustainable Agro-Pastoral and Land
            Management Promotion Project, aims to reduce poverty by
            promoting sustainable rural development, including
            marginalized groups. The indigenous people development plan
            (IPDP) identified a numbers of risks the indigenous peoples
            (IPs) could face as result of the implementation of the
            project, if left unattended. Such risks could include
            further marginalization; fewer government services; loss of
            control over land traditionally use by IPs as a source of
            livelihood and basis for their cultural and social system;
            less access to education, health services and clean water,
            and less income from agricultural production. The IPDP makes
            specific recommendations which have been agreed with the
            Cameroonian authorities designated to mitigate these risks,
            as follows : equal legal opportunities to IPs such as the
            provision of ID cards; establishment of community forests or
            traditional hunting zones; participation in the elaboration
            of community development plans and development of local
            action plans; equal opportunities such as special programs
            for pygmees to benefit from job creation opportunities;
            inclusion of IPs in various PNDP committees; provision of
            training on intercultural communication to civil servants
            working with pygmy populations; equal opportunities such as
            assisting Baka and Kola associations in capacity building to
            preserve the loss of traditional knowledge, culture and
            livelihood patterns; foster the creation of forums for
            communication and exchange between pygmies and other ethnic
            groups; and finally, in an effort to implement these
            recommendations, hire a consultant to carryout a study that
            will facilitate the participation of IPs in the
            socio-economic development activities generated by the project
